metadata.title: Biblical Figures Database - Non-Genealogical
metadata.description: Comprehensive database of biblical figures not in genealogy records, organized by categories, time periods, and stories

elijah.name: Elijah
elijah.bio: Mighty prophet of the Northern Kingdom during reign of Ahab and Jezebel. Name means 'My God is Yahweh.' Confronted Baal worship. Fed by ravens at brook Cherith. Sustained widow of Zarephath, raising her son from death. Challenged 450 prophets of Baal on Mount Carmel - fire fell from heaven. Ran before Ahab's chariot to Jezreel. Fled Jezebel's threat to cave at Horeb where God spoke in still small voice. Anointed Elisha as successor. Called down fire on Ahaziah's messengers. Taken to heaven in whirlwind with chariots of fire - did not see death. Appeared with Moses at Jesus' transfiguration.

elisha.name: Elisha
elisha.bio: Prophet and successor to Elijah. Name means 'God is salvation.' Son of Shaphat. Called while plowing with twelve yoke of oxen. Received double portion of Elijah's spirit. Performed many miracles: parted Jordan, healed Jericho's water, multiplied widow's oil, raised Shunammite's son, healed Naaman's leprosy, made iron axehead float, struck Arameans blind, prophesied to kings. Served during reigns of Jehoram, Jehu, Jehoahaz, and Joash. His bones raised a dead man even after his own death. Ministry spanned approximately 50 years.

isaiah.name: Isaiah
isaiah.bio: Major prophet in Judah. Name means 'Salvation of the LORD.' Son of Amoz. Prophesied during reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah - approximately 740-680 BC. Called in temple vision seeing the Lord high and lifted up, seraphim crying 'Holy, holy, holy.' Prophesied virgin birth of Messiah, suffering servant, and future glory. Advised King Hezekiah during Assyrian siege. Married to 'the prophetess,' had sons with prophetic names. Tradition says he was sawn in two during Manasseh's reign. Book contains 66 chapters with extensive Messianic prophecies.

jeremiah.name: Jeremiah
jeremiah.time_period: Kingdom Divided/Fall of Judah (7th-6th century BC)
jeremiah.bio: Major prophet called 'the weeping prophet.' Name means 'Yahweh establishes.' Son of Hilkiah, priest of Anathoth. Called as youth. Prophesied during reigns of Josiah through Zedekiah. Warned of Babylonian captivity for 40+ years. Imprisoned, thrown in muddy cistern, rescued by Ebed-melech. Witnessed fall of Jerusalem in 586 BC. Forced to Egypt with remnant. Wrote Lamentations. Prophesied new covenant written on hearts. Forbidden to marry as sign of coming judgment. Known for passionate prayers and complaints to God.

ezekiel.name: Ezekiel
ezekiel.bio: Major prophet during Babylonian captivity. Name means 'God strengthens.' Son of Buzi the priest. Taken captive to Babylon in 597 BC with King Jehoiachin. Called at age 30 by Chebar canal with vision of four living creatures and wheels within wheels. Prophesied to Jewish exiles. Performed dramatic sign-acts. Struck mute except when prophesying. Wife died as sign - he didn't mourn. Vision of valley of dry bones. Saw God's glory depart and return to temple. Prophesied against nations. Detailed vision of millennial temple.

daniel.name: Daniel
daniel.bio: Prophet and government official in Babylon and Persia. Name means 'God is my judge.' Of royal or noble lineage from Judah. Taken captive as youth around 605 BC. With friends refused king's food, ate vegetables. Interpreted Nebuchadnezzar's dreams. Made ruler over Babylon. Served under Nebuchadnezzar, Belshazzar, Darius, and Cyrus. Read handwriting on wall. Thrown in lions' den for praying to God - lions' mouths shut. Given visions of four beasts, ram and goat, seventy weeks, and end times. Called 'greatly beloved.' Ezekiel mentioned him with Noah and Job for righteousness.

jonah.name: Jonah
jonah.bio: Prophet to Nineveh. Son of Amittai from Gath-hepher in Zebulun. God commanded him to preach to Nineveh. Fled to Tarshish by ship. Storm arose, sailors cast lots, fell on Jonah. He told them to throw him overboard. Swallowed by great fish three days and three nights. Prayed from fish's belly. Fish vomited him onto dry land. Went to Nineveh, preached 'Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown.' Whole city repented from king to animals. God spared city. Jonah angry, wanted to die. God taught him lesson with gourd. Jesus referenced Jonah as sign of His resurrection.

john_baptist.name: John the Baptist
john_baptist.bio: Forerunner and herald of Jesus Christ. Son of Zacharias the priest and Elisabeth. Birth announced by angel Gabriel - parents were old and barren. Filled with Holy Ghost from womb. Lived in wilderness, wore camel's hair, ate locusts and wild honey. Preached repentance and baptism. Baptized Jesus in Jordan - saw Spirit descend like dove. Declared Jesus 'Lamb of God.' Sent disciples to Jesus. Rebuked Herod Antipas for marrying Herodias. Imprisoned and beheaded at Herodias' daughter's request. Jesus called him greatest born of women.

peter.name: Peter (Simon Peter)
peter.bio: Chief apostle, spokesman for the twelve. Born Simon, son of Jona, brother of Andrew. Fisherman from Bethsaida, lived in Capernaum. Married. Called by Jesus at Sea of Galilee. Jesus renamed him Cephas (Peter) meaning 'rock.' Part of inner circle with James and John. Walked on water, began to sink. Confessed Jesus as Christ at Caesarea Philippi - received keys of kingdom. Cut off servant's ear in garden. Denied Jesus three times, wept bitterly. Restored by Jesus. Preached at Pentecost - 3,000 saved. Healed lame man. Vision of unclean animals - sent to Cornelius. Freed from prison by angel. Wrote 1 and 2 Peter.
peter.scripture: Matthew 4, 14, 16-17, 26; Mark 8, 14; Luke 5, 22; John 1, 6, 13, 18, 21; Acts 1-5, 9-12, 15; Galatians 2; 1-2 Peter

paul.name: Paul (Saul of Tarsus)
paul.bio: Apostle to Gentiles, greatest missionary. Born Saul in Tarsus, tribe of Benjamin, Roman citizen. Pharisee, student of Gamaliel. Persecuted church, held coats at Stephen's stoning. Converted on Damascus road - blinded by light, heard Jesus' voice. Baptized by Ananias. Called to preach to Gentiles. Three missionary journeys establishing churches. Jerusalem Council. Imprisoned multiple times. Shipwrecked three times. Received visions and revelations. Thorn in flesh. Wrote 13 epistles. Arrested in Jerusalem, appealed to Caesar. Imprisoned in Rome. Tradition says beheaded under Nero.

john_apostle.name: John (Apostle)
john_apostle.bio: Beloved apostle, son of Zebedee, brother of James. Fisherman from Galilee. Part of Jesus' inner circle with Peter and James. Called 'son of thunder.' Wanted to call fire down on Samaritans. Requested seat at Jesus' right hand. At transfiguration, Gethsemane, and crucifixion. Only apostle at the cross - Jesus gave him care of Mary. Raced Peter to empty tomb. Fishing when Jesus appeared. With Peter healed lame man, arrested by Sanhedrin. Wrote Gospel of John, 1-3 John, Revelation. Exiled to Patmos where he received Revelation. Called himself 'the disciple whom Jesus loved.' Only apostle to die natural death. Lived to old age in Ephesus.

james_apostle.name: James (Son of Zebedee)
james_apostle.bio: Apostle, son of Zebedee, brother of John. Fisherman from Galilee. Part of Jesus' inner circle with Peter and John. Called 'son of thunder' with John. Wanted to call fire down on Samaritans. Requested seat at Jesus' left hand. At transfiguration and Gethsemane. First apostle to be martyred - killed by sword by Herod Agrippa I around 44 AD. Jesus predicted his martyrdom when James and John sought positions of honor. Mother was Salome, possibly Jesus' aunt.

andrew.name: Andrew
andrew.bio: Apostle, brother of Simon Peter. From Bethsaida. Originally disciple of John the Baptist. First called by Jesus after John declared 'Behold the Lamb of God.' Immediately brought Peter to Jesus. At feeding of 5,000, found boy with loaves and fishes. With Philip brought Greeks to Jesus. One of four who asked Jesus privately about end times on Mount of Olives. Present at upper room after resurrection. Tradition says he preached in Scythia and Greece. Martyred in Achaia (Greece) by crucifixion on X-shaped cross (St. Andrew's Cross). Known for bringing others to Jesus.

philip_apostle.name: Philip (Apostle)
philip_apostle.bio: Apostle from Bethsaida. Jesus found Philip and said 'Follow me.' Philip found Nathanael and said 'We have found him of whom Moses and the prophets did write.' At feeding of 5,000, Jesus tested Philip asking where to buy bread - Philip calculated it would take 200 denarii. With Andrew brought Greeks to Jesus before crucifixion. Asked Jesus 'Show us the Father' at Last Supper - Jesus replied 'He that hath seen me hath seen the Father.' Different from Philip the Evangelist (deacon). Tradition says he preached in Phrygia and died in Hierapolis.

matthew.name: Matthew (Levi)
matthew.bio: Apostle and gospel writer. Tax collector (publican) at Capernaum. Also called Levi, son of Alphaeus. Jesus called him from tax booth - he left all and followed. Held great feast for Jesus in his house with many publicans. Criticized by Pharisees - Jesus said 'I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.' Wrote Gospel of Matthew emphasizing Jesus as Messiah King, many Old Testament quotations. Wrote for Jewish audience. Gospel covers genealogy, birth, ministry, death, and resurrection. Tradition says he preached in Judea then Ethiopia, martyred in Ethiopia or Persia.

thomas.name: Thomas (Didymus)
thomas.bio: Apostle called Didymus (twin). When Jesus wanted to return to Judea after Lazarus died, Thomas said 'Let us also go, that we may die with him' - showing courage and devotion. At Last Supper asked Jesus 'Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how can we know the way?' - Jesus replied 'I am the way, the truth, and the life.' Absent when Jesus first appeared to disciples after resurrection. Said 'Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails... I will not believe.' Week later Jesus appeared, showed wounds, said 'Be not faithless, but believing.' Thomas confessed 'My Lord and my God!' Jesus said 'Blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.' Tradition says preached in India, martyred there.

bartholomew.name: Bartholomew (Nathanael)
bartholomew.bio: Apostle, probably same as Nathanael. From Cana of Galilee. Philip brought him to Jesus. Jesus said 'Behold an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile!' Nathanael asked 'How knowest thou me?' Jesus said 'Before Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.' Nathanael confessed 'Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.' Jesus promised he would see heaven opened and angels ascending and descending on Son of Man. Present when Jesus appeared at Sea of Tiberias after resurrection. Tradition says he preached in Armenia and India, martyred by being flayed alive.

james_alphaeus.name: James (Son of Alphaeus)
james_alphaeus.bio: Apostle, son of Alphaeus. Called 'James the Less' possibly meaning younger or shorter, to distinguish from James son of Zebedee. Little recorded about him specifically in Scripture. Listed among the twelve apostles. Present in upper room after ascension. Possibly same as 'James the brother of Jesus' though scholars debate this. If so, initially didn't believe in Jesus but converted after resurrection, became leader of Jerusalem church, wrote Epistle of James. Tradition says martyred in Egypt or Jerusalem. Also possibly Mary's son mentioned at crucifixion.

thaddaeus.name: Thaddaeus (Judas, son of James)
thaddaeus.bio: Apostle also called Lebbaeus and Judas (not Iscariot). Son of James. At Last Supper asked Jesus 'Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?' Jesus answered about keeping His commandments and the Father loving those who love Him. Listed among twelve apostles. Present in upper room after ascension. Little else recorded about him. Tradition says he preached in Judea, Samaria, Idumaea, Syria, Mesopotamia, and Libya. Possibly martyred in Persia with Simon the Zealot. May have written Epistle of Jude if same as Jude brother of James.

simon_zealot.name: Simon the Zealot
simon_zealot.bio: Apostle called 'the Zealot' or 'Canaanite' (Aramaic for zealot). Possibly former member of Zealots, Jewish political party opposing Roman rule. Listed among twelve apostles. Present in upper room after ascension. Nothing else specifically recorded about him in Scripture. Tradition says he preached in Egypt, then joined Jude in Persia where both were martyred. Some traditions say he traveled to Britain. Name Simon distinguishes him from Simon Peter. His presence among apostles shows Jesus called men from diverse backgrounds - zealot and tax collector (Matthew).

matthias.name: Matthias
matthias.bio: Apostle chosen to replace Judas Iscariot. After Judas' death, Peter said Scripture must be fulfilled - another must take his place among the twelve. Requirements: must have been with them from John's baptism through ascension. Two candidates: Joseph called Barsabas (Justus) and Matthias. They prayed asking God to show which He had chosen. Cast lots - lot fell on Matthias. He was numbered with the eleven apostles. Present at Pentecost. Tradition says he preached in Judea and was stoned to death. Some traditions say he went to Ethiopia. Nothing else recorded about him in Scripture.

barnabas.name: Barnabas
barnabas.bio: Apostle and missionary companion of Paul. Name means 'son of consolation.' Born Joseph, Levite from Cyprus. Sold land and gave proceeds to apostles. Introduced converted Saul to suspicious disciples. Sent from Jerusalem to Antioch - encouraged believers, called Christians there first. Brought Paul from Tarsus to Antioch. Took relief offering to Jerusalem. First missionary journey with Paul through Cyprus and Asia Minor. Jerusalem Council. Separated from Paul over John Mark (Barnabas' cousin). Continued ministry with Mark to Cyprus. Known as encouraging, generous, willing to give second chances.

mary_magdalene.name: Mary Magdalene
mary_magdalene.bio: Devoted follower of Jesus from whom He cast seven devils. From Magdala on Sea of Galilee. Provided for Jesus and disciples out of her substance with other women. Present at crucifixion when many fled. Watched where Jesus was laid. First to tomb on resurrection morning with spices. Found tomb empty. Saw two angels. First to see risen Christ - He said 'Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended.' Told disciples 'I have seen the Lord.' Often confused with sinful woman who anointed Jesus (Luke 7) or Mary of Bethany, but Scripture doesn't identify her as either. Represents transformed life and faithful devotion.

timothy.name: Timothy
timothy.bio: Young pastor and Paul's faithful disciple. Name means 'honoring God.' Son of Jewish mother Eunice and Greek father. Grandmother Lois also believer. From Lystra. Well spoken of by brethren. Joined Paul on second missionary journey - circumcised to avoid offense to Jews. With Paul in Philippi, Thessalonica, Berea. Sent back to encourage Thessalonians. Co-author of several Paul's epistles. Pastor in Ephesus. Paul wrote two letters instructing him in ministry. Warned against false teachers. Told to drink wine for stomach. 'Let no man despise thy youth.' Paul called him 'my own son in the faith.'
timothy.scripture: Acts 16:1-3, 17-20; Romans 16:21; 1 Corinthians 4:17, 16:10; Philippians 2:19-23; 1 Thessalonians 3:2-6; 1-2 Timothy; Hebrews 13:23

titus.name: Titus
titus.bio: Gentile convert and Paul's companion. Greek, not compelled to be circumcised at Jerusalem Council. Traveled with Paul to Jerusalem. Sent to Corinth to handle difficult situation, reconcile church with Paul. Reported good news to Paul in Macedonia. Collected offering for Jerusalem saints. Paul wrote epistle instructing him as pastor in Crete - to ordain elders, refute false teachers, promote sound doctrine. Called 'mine own son after the common faith' and 'my partner and fellowhelper.' Later sent to Dalmatia. Tradition says first bishop of Crete. Known for tact and ability to restore relationships.

silas.name: Silas (Silvanus)
silas.bio: Prophet and missionary companion of Paul. Also called Silvanus. Leading man among brethren. Chosen with Judas Barsabas to accompany Paul and Barnabas from Jerusalem Council with letter to Gentiles. Exhorted brethren in Antioch. Paul chose Silas for second missionary journey after separating from Barnabas. Beaten and imprisoned with Paul in Philippi - prayed and sang at midnight, earthquake freed them. In Thessalonica, Berea, Corinth. Co-authored 1-2 Thessalonians. May have been Peter's scribe for 1 Peter. Roman citizen like Paul. Known for courage and faithfulness under persecution.

luke.name: Luke
luke.bio: Physician and gospel writer. Paul called him 'the beloved physician.' Gentile, possibly from Antioch. Only Gentile author of Scripture. Traveled with Paul on missionary journeys - 'we' passages in Acts indicate his presence. With Paul during imprisonments. Wrote Gospel of Luke emphasizing Jesus as Son of Man, universal Savior. Carefully investigated accounts, wrote orderly narrative to Theophilus. Wrote Acts of the Apostles continuing story through early church. Emphasized Holy Spirit, prayer, joy, women, outcasts, Samaritans. Medical language in writings. Paul said 'Only Luke is with me' near end. Tradition says he painted icons, died around age 84.

mark.name: Mark (John Mark)
mark.bio: Gospel writer and missionary. Full name John Mark. Mother was Mary who hosted prayer meeting when Peter was in prison. Relative (cousin) of Barnabas. Accompanied Paul and Barnabas on first missionary journey. Left them at Perga to return to Jerusalem. Paul refused to take him on second journey - caused split between Paul and Barnabas. Barnabas took Mark to Cyprus. Later restored to Paul - Paul said 'he is profitable to me for the ministry.' Peter called him 'Marcus my son.' Wrote Gospel of Mark, possibly recording Peter's testimony. Emphasized Jesus as Servant. Shortest gospel, action-packed, 'immediately' used often. Tradition says founded church in Alexandria.

stephen.name: Stephen
stephen.bio: First Christian martyr. One of seven chosen as deacon to serve tables - full of faith and Holy Ghost. Did great wonders and miracles among people. Disputed with Hellenistic Jews who couldn't resist his wisdom and spirit. False witnesses accused him of blasphemy. Brought before council - his face shone like angel. Gave powerful sermon recounting Israel's history and resistance to God. Accused leaders of betraying and murdering the Just One. Saw heaven opened and Jesus standing at God's right hand. Dragged outside city and stoned. Prayed 'Lord Jesus, receive my spirit' and 'Lord, lay not this sin to their charge.' Saul held coats of those stoning him.

philip_deacon.name: Philip the Evangelist
philip_deacon.bio: One of seven deacons, evangelist. Different from Philip the Apostle. Full of Holy Ghost and wisdom. After Stephen's martyrdom, went to Samaria preaching Christ. Great miracles - unclean spirits cast out, paralyzed and lame healed. Whole city had great joy. Simon the sorcerer believed and was baptized. Peter and John came, laid hands for Holy Ghost. Angel sent Philip to Gaza road. Met Ethiopian eunuch reading Isaiah 53. Philip explained Jesus was suffering servant. Eunuch believed, baptized in water. Spirit caught Philip away to Azotus. Preached through coastal cities to Caesarea. Had four virgin daughters who prophesied. Paul stayed at his house. Called 'the evangelist.'

lydia.name: Lydia
lydia.bio: First European convert to Christianity. Businesswoman from Thyatira, city famous for purple dye. Seller of purple cloth - expensive luxury item indicating she was wealthy. Worshipper of God (likely Gentile God-fearer). In Philippi when Paul preached by riverside. 'The Lord opened her heart' to believe Paul's message. Baptized with her household. Insisted Paul and companions stay at her home - showed hospitality. Her home likely became meeting place for Philippian church. Represents God's providence in gospel spreading to Europe, importance of women in early church, and blessing of hospitality.

dorcas.name: Dorcas (Tabitha)
dorcas.bio: Faithful disciple raised from the dead by Peter. Name Tabitha in Aramaic, Dorcas in Greek - both mean 'gazelle.' Lived in Joppa. Full of good works and almsdeeds. Made coats and garments for poor, especially widows. Fell sick and died. Disciples laid her in upper chamber. Sent for Peter from nearby Lydda. Peter put everyone out, knelt and prayed, said 'Tabitha, arise.' She opened eyes, sat up. Peter presented her alive. News spread throughout Joppa - many believed in the Lord. Only woman in Bible called a 'disciple' (female form). Example of ministry of helps and serving others.

cornelius.name: Cornelius
cornelius.bio: First Gentile convert, Roman centurion. Stationed in Caesarea with Italian regiment. Devout man who feared God with all his house. Gave much alms to people, prayed to God always. Angel appeared in vision telling him to send for Peter in Joppa. Sent two servants and devout soldier. While they traveled, Peter had vision three times of unclean animals - voice said 'What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.' Spirit told Peter three men sought him. Peter went with them to Cornelius. Large gathering assembled. While Peter preached Jesus, Holy Ghost fell on all who heard. Jewish believers amazed Gentiles received Holy Ghost, spoke in tongues. Peter commanded they be baptized. Breakthrough showing gospel for all nations.

priscilla.name: Priscilla (Prisca)
priscilla.bio: Wife of Aquila, faithful co-worker with Paul. Jewish Christian from Rome. Expelled from Rome with Aquila under Claudius' edict (49 AD). Tentmakers like Paul. Hosted Paul in Corinth. Traveled with Paul to Ephesus. Church met in their house in Ephesus. Heard eloquent Apollos preach - took him aside and 'expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.' Later had church in house in Rome. Risked their necks for Paul's life - all Gentile churches grateful. Name usually mentioned before husband's - unusual for time, indicating prominence. Paul sent greetings through them in 2 Timothy. Example of husband-wife ministry team, hospitality, teaching, and courage.

aquila.name: Aquila
aquila.bio: Husband of Priscilla, faithful co-worker with Paul. Jew from Pontus. Lived in Rome until expelled by Claudius' edict. Tentmaker by trade. Moved to Corinth where he met Paul - they worked together making tents. Church met in their home. Traveled with Paul to Ephesus. With Priscilla taught Apollos. Had house church in Ephesus, later in Rome again. Risked life for Paul. Paul called them 'my helpers in Christ Jesus.' Always mentioned with wife - partnership in ministry, business, and teaching. Example of faithful lay leader using home and business for God's work.

apollos.name: Apollos
apollos.bio: Eloquent preacher from Alexandria. Jew, learned, mighty in Scriptures. Instructed in way of the Lord, fervent in spirit. Taught accurately about Jesus but knew only John's baptism. Spoke boldly in Ephesus synagogue. Priscilla and Aquila heard him, took him aside, explained way more perfectly. Went to Achaia with letter of commendation. Helped believers greatly through grace. Powerfully refuted Jews publicly, showing Jesus was Christ from Scriptures. Ministered in Corinth - some preferred him to Paul, causing divisions. Paul said 'I planted, Apollos watered, but God gave the increase.' Paul urged him to visit Corinth but he was reluctant. Known for eloquence and scriptural knowledge. Possibly author of Hebrews (speculation).

gideon.name: Gideon
gideon.bio: Judge who delivered Israel from Midianites. Youngest son of Joash, from tribe of Manasseh. Angel appeared while he threshed wheat by winepress hiding from Midianites. Called 'mighty man of valour' though felt weak. Asked for signs - fleece wet/dry. Tore down father's Baal altar, built altar to LORD called Jehovah-shalom. Blew trumpet, gathered army of 32,000. God reduced to 300 who lapped water. Used trumpets, pitchers, lamps to confuse enemy. Midianites killed each other fleeing. Refused to be king - 'The LORD shall rule over you.' Made golden ephod which became snare. Judged Israel 40 years. Had 70 sons. Also called Jerubbaal.

samson.name: Samson
samson.bio: Judge with supernatural strength. From tribe of Dan. Birth announced by angel to barren mother - to be Nazarite from womb (no wine, no haircut, no dead bodies). Desired Philistine wife from Timnath. Killed lion with bare hands - later found honey in carcass. Gave riddle at wedding feast. Wife betrayed him to Philistines. Killed 30 men of Ashkelon. Set foxes' tails on fire, burned Philistine crops. Killed 1,000 Philistines with donkey's jawbone. Loved Delilah who betrayed him for silver. Nagged him until he revealed strength was in hair. Philistines cut hair, gouged out eyes, imprisoned him. Hair grew back. At temple feast to Dagon, pushed pillars down, killed more in death than life. Judged Israel 20 years.

deborah.name: Deborah
deborah.bio: Only female judge of Israel, prophetess. Wife of Lapidoth. Judged Israel under palm tree between Ramah and Bethel. Israel oppressed 20 years by Jabin, Canaanite king. Deborah called Barak to gather 10,000 men against Sisera's army. Barak refused to go unless Deborah came - she agreed but said a woman would get the glory. At Mount Tabor, LORD discomfited Sisera's army. Sisera fled on foot to Jael's tent. Jael gave him milk, he slept. She drove tent peg through his temple - killed him. Deborah and Barak sang victory song (Judges 5). Land had rest 40 years. Called 'a mother in Israel.'

barak.name: Barak
barak.bio: Military commander, son of Abinoam from Kedesh-naphtali. Deborah summoned him to lead 10,000 men from Naphtali and Zebulun against Sisera. Refused to go without Deborah - she agreed but prophesied a woman would get honor. Gathered troops at Mount Tabor. Sisera assembled 900 iron chariots. LORD discomfited Sisera's army - Barak pursued. Sisera fled, killed by Jael. Barak and Deborah sang victory song. Listed in Hebrews 11 as example of faith. Represents obedience despite fear, importance of godly counsel, and willingness to share glory.

jael.name: Jael
jael.bio: Wife of Heber the Kenite. After Sisera's army was defeated, he fled on foot to her tent (Kenites had peace with King Jabin). Jael went out to meet him, invited him into tent. Covered him with mantle. He asked for water, she gave him milk. He told her to stand at door, deny he was there. Sisera fell asleep exhausted. Jael took tent peg and hammer, drove peg through his temple into ground - he died. When Barak pursued Sisera, Jael showed him Sisera dead. Fulfilled Deborah's prophecy that woman would get honor. Praised in Deborah's song: 'Blessed above women shall Jael be.' Represents courage and decisive action for God's people.

ruth.name: Ruth
ruth.bio: Moabite widow who became great-grandmother of King David, ancestor of Jesus. Married Mahlon, son of Elimelech and Naomi, during famine when they moved to Moab. After husband died, refused to leave mother-in-law Naomi. Said 'Whither thou goest, I will go... thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God.' Returned to Bethlehem with Naomi. Gleaned in fields of Boaz (kinsman of Elimelech). Boaz showed her favor. Naomi advised her to lie at Boaz's feet at threshing floor. Boaz performed role of kinsman-redeemer, married Ruth. Bore Obed, grandfather of David. Listed in genealogy of Jesus (Matthew 1). Model of devotion, faith, and virtue.

hannah.name: Hannah
hannah.bio: Mother of Samuel, woman of prayer. One of two wives of Elkanah from Ramathaimzophim in Ephraim. Barren while rival Peninnah had children. Peninnah provoked her yearly. Wept and prayed bitterly at tabernacle in Shiloh. Vowed if given son, would give him to LORD all his days, no razor on his head (Nazarite vow). Moved lips silently - Eli the priest thought she was drunk. She said 'I am a woman of sorrowful spirit... I have poured out my soul before the LORD.' Eli blessed her. Conceived, bore Samuel. After weaning, brought him to tabernacle, kept her vow. Prayed magnificent prayer of praise (1 Samuel 2) - echoed in Mary's Magnificat. LORD gave her five more children. Model of faith, prayer, and worship.

naaman.name: Naaman
naaman.bio: Syrian commander healed of leprosy by Elisha. Captain of host of king of Syria, great man, honorable, mighty man of valour, but leper. Wife's Israelite servant girl told of prophet in Samaria who could heal. King sent Naaman with letter to king of Israel - king distressed. Elisha sent for Naaman. Elisha's messenger told him to wash seven times in Jordan. Naaman angry - expected prophet to come out, wave hand. Rivers of Damascus better than Israel's waters. Servants persuaded him to obey. Dipped seven times, flesh restored like child's. Returned, confessed 'there is no God in all the earth, but in Israel.' Offered gifts - Elisha refused. Gehazi ran after him, lied, took gifts - struck with leprosy. Jesus mentioned Naaman as example of faith.

nebuchadnezzar.name: Nebuchadnezzar
nebuchadnezzar.bio: Greatest king of Babylon, conquered Judah. Son of Nabopolassar. Defeated Egyptians at Carchemish (605 BC). Became king of Babylon. Besieged Jerusalem three times (605, 597, 586 BC). Took Daniel and nobles as captives. Burned temple, destroyed Jerusalem, exiled Jews. Had troubling dream of statue with gold head - Daniel interpreted. Made gold image on plain of Dura - threw Shadrach, Meshach, Abednego into fiery furnace for refusing to worship. Saw fourth man like Son of God in fire. Had dream of tree cut down - Daniel interpreted as seven years of madness. Driven from men, ate grass like beast. After seven times, reason returned, blessed Most High. Acknowledged God's sovereignty.

cyrus.name: Cyrus the Great
cyrus.bio: Persian king who freed Jews from Babylonian captivity. Founded Achaemenid Persian Empire. Isaiah prophesied his name 150 years before his birth, called God's 'shepherd' and 'anointed' (Isaiah 44:28-45:1). Conquered Babylon in 539 BC without battle. Found his name in Scripture. First year issued decree allowing Jews to return, rebuild temple. Returned sacred vessels Nebuchadnezzar had taken. Provided funding for temple. 42,360 Jews returned under Zerubbabel. Reigned 29 years. Policy of allowing captive peoples to return home and worship their gods was revolutionary. Represents God using pagan kings for His purposes and fulfilling prophecy.

herod_great.name: Herod the Great
herod_great.bio: Idumean king of Judea during Jesus' birth. Son of Antipater. Appointed king by Roman Senate 40 BC, took Jerusalem 37 BC. Married ten wives including Mariamne I whom he later murdered. Rebuilt temple magnificently starting 20 BC. Paranoid, murderous. Killed his own sons. Wise men came seeking 'King of Jews.' Herod troubled, inquired where Christ should be born. Told them Bethlehem. Sent them to search diligently. They didn't return. Herod sent soldiers, killed all children in Bethlehem under two years (Massacre of Innocents). Joseph fled with Mary and Jesus to Egypt. Herod died shortly after (4 BC), kingdom divided among sons.

herod_antipas.name: Herod Antipas
herod_antipas.bio: Tetrarch of Galilee and Perea, son of Herod the Great. Ruled from 4 BC to 39 AD. Married Herodias, his brother Philip's wife. John the Baptist rebuked him for this unlawful marriage. Herodias had grudge against John. At Herod's birthday feast, Herodias' daughter danced, pleased Herod. He promised her anything up to half his kingdom. Prompted by mother, she asked for John's head on platter. Herod sorry but kept oath, beheaded John. Heard of Jesus, thought He was John risen. Desired to see Jesus. At Jesus' trial, Pilate sent Jesus to Herod. Herod questioned Him, mocked Him, dressed Him in gorgeous robe, sent back to Pilate. Jesus called him 'that fox.'

pilate.name: Pontius Pilate
pilate.bio: Roman prefect of Judea who condemned Jesus. Appointed 26 AD, served until 36 AD. Jewish leaders brought Jesus before him - couldn't execute under Roman law. Questioned Jesus: 'Art thou the King of Jews?' Found no fault. Sent to Herod Antipas. Herod returned Him. Pilate offered to release Jesus or Barabbas per Passover custom - crowd chose Barabbas. Wife sent message warning of dream about 'that just man.' Pilate tried to release Jesus but Jews threatened 'thou art not Caesar's friend.' Scourged Jesus. Soldiers mocked Him, put crown of thorns, purple robe. Pilate said 'Behold the man' and 'Behold your King.' Jews shouted 'Crucify him!' Pilate washed hands - 'I am innocent of the blood of this just person.' Symbolizes political cowardice.

judas_iscariot.name: Judas Iscariot
judas_iscariot.bio: Apostle who betrayed Jesus. Son of Simon Iscariot, possibly from Kerioth in Judea. Treasurer for disciples but was thief, stole from money bag. At Bethany complained when Mary anointed Jesus with expensive ointment. Satan entered him. Made deal with chief priests to betray Jesus for thirty pieces of silver. At Last Supper, Jesus said one would betray Him. Gave Judas sop, said 'That thou doest, do quickly.' Judas left immediately. Led soldiers to Gethsemane, kissed Jesus to identify Him. Later remorseful, returned silver saying 'I have sinned in that I have betrayed innocent blood.' They rejected it. Judas threw money in temple, went and hanged himself. Body fell, burst open. Priests bought potter's field with money. Jesus called him 'son of perdition.'

barabbas.name: Barabbas
barabbas.bio: Notorious prisoner released instead of Jesus. Robber, insurrectionist, and murderer. Imprisoned for sedition and murder committed in insurrection against Rome. Name means 'son of the father' - ironic parallel to Jesus, Son of the Father. At Passover, Pilate had custom of releasing one prisoner. Offered crowd choice between Jesus and Barabbas. Chief priests and elders persuaded people to ask for Barabbas. Pilate asked 'What shall I do with Jesus?' They cried 'Let him be crucified!' Pilate released Barabbas, delivered Jesus to be crucified. Represents humanity choosing sin over salvation, also substitutionary atonement - guilty goes free, innocent dies. Scripture doesn't record what happened to him after.

caiaphas.name: Caiaphas (Joseph Caiaphas)
caiaphas.bio: High priest who condemned Jesus. Son-in-law of Annas (former high priest). Served as high priest 18-36 AD, appointed by Roman prefect. After Lazarus raised, chief priests and Pharisees gathered council. Caiaphas said 'it is expedient for us, that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation perish not' - unknowingly prophesying. Plotted to kill Jesus. At Jesus' arrest, soldiers brought Him to Annas first, then Caiaphas. Council assembled illegally at night at Caiaphas' house. False witnesses testified. Caiaphas asked 'Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?' Jesus said 'I am.' Caiaphas tore clothes, declared blasphemy. Council condemned Him to death. Took Jesus to Pilate. Accused Jesus before Pilate and Herod.

annas.name: Annas
annas.bio: Former high priest, father-in-law of Caiaphas. Served as high priest 6-15 AD, deposed by Romans but retained title and influence. Five sons also became high priests. Powerful leader of Sadducees. After Jesus' arrest, soldiers brought Him to Annas first before Caiaphas. Annas questioned Jesus about disciples and doctrine. Jesus answered He spoke openly, ask those who heard. Officer struck Jesus for answering so. Annas sent Him bound to Caiaphas. Peter and John brought before council including Annas after healing lame man. Annas questioned them 'By what power, or by what name, have ye done this?' Peter, filled with Holy Ghost, testified boldly about Jesus. Represents religious corruption and opposition to truth.

nicodemus.name: Nicodemus
nicodemus.bio: Pharisee, ruler of Jews, secret disciple of Jesus. Member of Sanhedrin. Came to Jesus by night, called Him 'Rabbi' and 'teacher from God.' Jesus told him 'Ye must be born again.' Nicodemus asked 'How can a man be born when he is old?' Jesus explained being born of water and Spirit. Nicodemus asked 'How can these things be?' Jesus taught about heavenly things and gave John 3:16. Later, at council meeting where leaders sought to arrest Jesus, Nicodemus defended Him: 'Doth our law judge any man, before it hear him?' They scorned him. After crucifixion, came with Joseph of Arimathea to bury Jesus, brought 100 pounds myrrh and aloes. Helped prepare body, place in tomb. Represents secret believers who eventually professed faith boldly.

joseph_arimathea.name: Joseph of Arimathea
joseph_arimathea.bio: Rich man, member of Sanhedrin, secret disciple of Jesus. From Arimathea, counselor, good and just man. Waited for kingdom of God. Had not consented to council's decision to kill Jesus. After crucifixion, boldly went to Pilate, asked for Jesus' body. Pilate marveled Jesus was already dead, confirmed with centurion, gave body to Joseph. Joseph bought fine linen, took body down, wrapped in linen. Nicodemus came with spices. Laid Jesus in Joseph's own new tomb hewn out of rock, never used. Rolled great stone to door. Mary Magdalene and other Mary watched. Represents hidden disciples who step forward in crisis, sacrificial giving, and care for Jesus even in death. Tradition says he founded church in Britain.

lazarus.name: Lazarus
lazarus.bio: Brother of Mary and Martha, raised from dead by Jesus. From Bethany. Jesus loved Martha, Mary, and Lazarus. Lazarus fell sick. Sisters sent message to Jesus. Jesus said sickness not unto death, for God's glory. Jesus stayed two more days, then went to Judea. Disciples warned of danger. Jesus said Lazarus sleeps, He goes to wake him. Disciples thought he meant natural sleep. Jesus said plainly 'Lazarus is dead.' Thomas said 'Let us also go, that we may die with him.' Lazarus had been dead four days when Jesus arrived. Martha met Jesus, said if He'd been there, brother wouldn't have died. Jesus said 'I am the resurrection and the life.' Jesus wept at tomb. Commanded stone removed. Called 'Lazarus, come forth!' Lazarus came out bound hand and foot. Many believed. Chief priests plotted to kill Lazarus too. Sat at supper with Jesus, Mary anointed Jesus' feet.

martha.name: Martha
martha.bio: Sister of Mary and Lazarus, friend of Jesus. From Bethany near Jerusalem. Jesus visited their home. Martha served, Mary sat at Jesus' feet. Martha came to Jesus saying 'Lord, dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone?' Jesus answered 'Martha, Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things: But one thing is needful: and Mary hath chosen that good part.' When Lazarus died, Martha went to meet Jesus. Confessed 'I believe that thou art the Christ, the Son of God.' Called Mary. When Jesus asked to see tomb, Martha said 'Lord, by this time he stinketh: for he hath been dead four days.' Jesus reminded her of His promise. Lazarus raised. Martha served at supper six days before Passover. Represents service, hospitality, confession of faith, growing understanding.

mary_bethany.name: Mary (of Bethany)
mary_bethany.bio: Sister of Martha and Lazarus, devoted follower of Jesus. From Bethany. When Jesus visited, sat at His feet listening. Martha complained, Jesus defended Mary: 'Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.' When Lazarus died, stayed in house until Martha called her. Fell at Jesus' feet weeping. Jesus groaned in spirit, troubled, wept. Six days before Passover, at supper in Bethany, took pound of costly spikenard ointment, anointed Jesus' feet, wiped with her hair. House filled with fragrance. Judas complained of waste. Jesus defended her: 'Let her alone... she is come aforehand to anoint my body to the burying.' Said wherever gospel preached, her deed would be told. Represents devotion, worship, extravagant love, prophetic action.

zacchaeus.name: Zacchaeus
zacchaeus.bio: Chief tax collector in Jericho, converted by Jesus. Rich man, short of stature. Sought to see Jesus but couldn't because of crowd. Ran ahead, climbed sycamore tree. Jesus looked up, said 'Zacchaeus, make haste, and come down; for to day I must abide at thy house.' Zacchaeus received Him joyfully. People murmured Jesus went to be guest of sinner. Zacchaeus stood, said 'Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation, I restore him fourfold.' Jesus said 'This day is salvation come to this house... For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.' Represents dramatic conversion, restitution, generosity, and Jesus seeking the lost.

samaritan_woman.name: The Samaritan Woman
samaritan_woman.bio: Samaritan woman converted at Jacob's well. Came to draw water at noon (unusual time). Jesus, tired from journey, sat at well. Asked her for drink. She surprised - Jews don't deal with Samaritans. Jesus said 'If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is... thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.' She asked for this water. Jesus told her to call husband. She said 'I have no husband.' Jesus said 'Thou hast well said... thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband.' She called Him prophet. Discussed worship. Jesus revealed He was Messiah. She left waterpot, ran to city saying 'Come, see a man, which told me all things... is not this the Christ?' Many believed. Jesus stayed two days. More believed because of His word. Represents evangelistic zeal and Jesus' inclusiveness.
